programme.title: Freaky Eaters USA
programme.desc: Michael's fixation with eating nothing but meat is putting both his health and his relationship in jeopardy, with his childhood sweetheart Genna threatening to leave him if he cannot change his diet. Psychotherapist Mike Dow and nutritionist JJ Virgin attempt to help him save his relationship.

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: The programme is back to review the latest technological devices on the market. Jason Bradbury and Amy Williams going head-to-head to see who can design the next big thing in gadgets, creating a drone with a difference and a next-generation item of wearable technology. Gadget Show China presenter Yue Xu heads to Las Vegas for one of the world's biggest consumer tech events and Ortis Deley travels to Manchester to visit the home of graphene, a highly conductive material which is 200 times stronger than steel.

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Fearless hunter Allan Quatermain teams up with a host of other characters from Victorian literature - including Captain Nemo, the Invisible Man, Tom Sawyer and Dr Jekyll - to put a stop to the nefarious Fantom's evil plot to bring about a world war. Fantasy adventure, based on Alan Moore's comic-book series, starring Sean Connery, Shane West, Stuart Townsend, Richard Roxburgh, Peta Wilson and Tony Curran.

programme.title: Ladder 49
programme.desc: A fireman becomes trapped in a burning building and, aware his chances of survival are slim, reflects on the events that led him to his chosen career. He recalls his rise from the station's laughing stock to a respected member of the team, and the effect his dangerous profession has had on his family. Meanwhile, his mentor is battling to get him out of the building alive. Drama, with Joaquin Phoenix, John Travolta, Jacinda Barrett and Robert Patrick.

programme.title: Top 20 Funniest
programme.desc: More comical video clips from America, including lawnmower wheelies, elderly video-game action and amateur stunts.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: Psychologists and criminology experts analyse the personality of cross-dressing killer Hadden Clark. In 1986, six-year-old Michele Dorr vanished from outside her father's home, but investigators were left puzzled and unable to find her body. Years later, another victim disappeared in a crime that carried a haunting resemblance to the first. When investigators finally fingered Clark as the perpetrator of both murders, he went on to claim he was responsible for many more.

programme.title: Benefits Britain: Life on the Dole
programme.desc: This edition focuses on young people living on state welfare, including 18-year-old Dean from Harlow in Essex, who has no intention of getting a job unless forced. Twentysomethings Danielle and her boyfriend Josh are unable to work due to anxiety and depression and have moved to Blackpool to make a new start. However, with four children between them from previous relationships and another on the way they are struggling to make ends meet on a joint benefits income of around £100 a week.

programme.title: Benefits Britain: Life on the Dole
programme.desc: Documentary examining the lives of people dependent on state welfare in the Norfolk seaside town of Great Yarmouth, where the majority of work is seasonal. Leona and Lee worry about their three-month-old daughter's future when their payments are cut because they failed to fill in the correct forms, while Jordan McDonald has his benefits halved after the job centre discovers he has not attended a government work programme.

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Paul and Steve discover a locked wooden case when they are called to evict tenants from a flat in London's Docklands. Opening it up, they realise they urgently need police back-up - and the property quickly becomes a crime scene. Brian and Graham head to Swindon Town FC to collect a debt, while Paul's team arrives at a property in Essex to find that they have to turf out a woman and her six children.

programme.title: Killer Psychopaths
programme.desc: David Wilson analyses the personality and motivations of serial killer Steve Wright, who was convicted in 2008 of murdering five women who worked as prostitutes in Ipswich, and became known as the Suffolk Strangler. With the aid of first-hand accounts from those involved at the time, including investigating officers, journalists and the killer's father, the criminologist reveals how the dark side of Wright's personality eventually took over.

programme.title: My Violent Child
programme.desc: Documentary about parents who are being physically abused by their children, beginning with two families whose lives are being ruined by violence in the home. Marcel believes his Asperger's syndrome is behind the outbursts that have seen him throttle both his parents and caused his 17-year-old sister to leave home, while Toby's violence is seriously affecting his mum and dad and his three siblings. Both families work with experts to try to solve their children's behavioural issues, including investigating possible childhood traumas.

programme.title: Kids Who Kill
programme.desc: Documentary examining the personalities of children who have been convicted of murder and analysing what motivated them to kill. Daniel Bartlam was 14 when he attacked his mother Jacqueline with a claw hammer and set her body on fire, while Santre Sanchez Gayle was just 15 when he was paid £200 to kill Gulistan Subasi in 2010. Other cases featured include that of brothers Connor and Brandon Doran and their 14-year-old friend Simon Evans, who kicked a homeless man to death for a dare, as well as Robert Thompson and Jon Venables who were 10 when they killed toddler James Bulger in 1993.

programme.desc: A Hollywood has-been actor signs up to appear in a remake of the popular 1960s sitcom about a housewife with magical powers. Determined that his co-star should be a complete unknown, he persuades the studio to hire a beguiling woman from the suburbs - unaware she is a genuine witch. Romantic fantasy comedy, with Nicole Kidman, Will Ferrell, Shirley MacLaine and Michael Caine.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jason heads to a Christmas party that has turned into a full-blown riot, while Adam and Nick catch a drunken woman giving her daughter a lift to the shops. Plus, Kev is seconds away from disaster when he places himself in the path of danger to prevent a car from becoming a fireball.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: Between 1975 and 1980, serial killer Peter Sutcliffe - known in the press as the Yorkshire Ripper - murdered 13 women and attacked at least seven more in the north of England. In this programme, psychologists and criminology experts analyse the personality of Sutcliffe and look at events in his childhood and adult life that may have triggered his descent into murder, and also examine how he managed to avoid suspicion despite being interviewed by police numerous times.

programme.title: Britain's Worst Crimes
programme.desc: The return of the documentary series focusing on some of Britain's most high-profile crimes. In May 2013, soldier Lee Rigby was attacked and murdered by Islamic extremists Michael Adebolajo and Michael Adebowale close to his barracks in Woolwich, south-east London. In this programme, witnesses to the attack recall the events and international experts on terrorism examine how the killers became radicalised.

programme.title: The Benefits Estate
programme.desc: Part one of two. Observational documentary following a year in the life of the residents of Darndale in north Dublin, one of Ireland's most notorious housing estates. Single mum Angelique reveals the social problems created by the alleyways and narrow cul-de-sacs, Noel anxiously awaits a place on a drug-treatment programme and street sweeper Tommy organises a Strictly Come Dancing-inspired fundraiser for the impoverished Darndale Football Club.

programme.title: Brits on the Piste
programme.desc: Nine men from Wales arrive at Pas de le Casa for a boozy holiday, while Marcus and Gwyn compete at snow rally driving, and Sophie celebrates her 23rd birthday with her work friends from the bar. Elsewhere, the residents of the resort discuss how the constant influx of British holidaymakers has affected their home town. Last in the series.

This documentary examines events surrounding the murder, the investigation and the trial, and features interviews with family, friends, police and prosecutors, as well as covert recordings, surveillance footage and personal archive material.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Steve Bower presents highlights of this weekend's only Premier League encounter, which saw Queens Park Rangers host Tottenham Hotspur at Loftus Road. QPR were looking for a morale-boosting win that would aid their fight against relegation, but they would have to improve greatly on their performance in the reverse fixture at White Hart Lane last August, which resulted in a 4-0 win for Spurs.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Dan Walker presents highlights of the first two sixth-round matches, as Bradford City faced Reading at Valley Parade and Aston Villa welcomed West Bromwich Albion to Villa Park. The Bantams have been one of the major talking points of this campaign, as they have already eliminated Premier League sides Chelsea and Sunderland, and they were looking to book their place in a Wembley semi-final by beating the Royals.

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: Round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures and leafing through the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.

programme.title: The Big Questions
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell visits Harris Academy, Peckham, to present moral and religious discussions on topical issues, with contributions by members of the studio audience.

programme.title: Sunday Politics
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including coverage from around the Province with Mark Carruthers.

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Singer Rebecca Ferguson discovers the origins of her favourite hymn Amazing Grace, and Pam Rhodes hears the story of a rescue at sea before reuniting those involved 35 years later. Plus, singing from across the country.

programme.title: Live Davis Cup Tennis
programme.sub-title: Great Britain v USA: Day Three
programme.desc: Great Britain v USA. Sue Barker presents coverage of the final day of the World Group first-round match at the Emirates Arena in Glasgow, featuring the concluding two singles rubbers. As ever for Britain, Andy Murray is the key figure in this tie, and the hosts would expect him to win both of his singles matches, but that still needs another player to win a fixture, as James Ward did against Sam Querrey when the nations met last year in San Diego. With commentary by Andrew Castle, John Lloyd and Jonathan Overend.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Students and teachers are challenged to pick up items to sell for profit in Swinderby, near Lincoln, with the assistance of experts James Braxton and David Harper. Presented by Tim Wonnacott.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: In Somerset, presenter Jules Hudson assists a retired baptist minister and his charity-worker wife's hunt for a home on a £500,000 budget. The host also goes looking for the elusive bittern - a small species of heron that nests in the Somerset Levels.

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts a theatre-themed edition of the quiz, featuring eight actors who often tread the boards. The pairs are Simon Callow and Imogen Stubbs, Lysette Anthony and Christopher Timothy, Gwen Taylor and Keith Barron, and Claire Sweeney and Simon Shepherd. Richard Osman has the answers.

programme.title: BBC News; Regional News and Weather
The Big Painting Challenge
programme.desc: The amateur artists travel to Blenheim Palace in Oxfordshire, the birthplace and ancestral home of Winston Churchill. Their first challenge sees them arranging a collection of personal items - from a large yellow hat to a skull - which they must capture on canvas using acrylics. This is followed by a quick 30-minute sketch of a giant chess board, ensuring that light and shadow are just as important as perspective and scale. In their last chance to impress before the elimination, the hopefuls paint the facade of the palace, attempting to capture the drama of its stunning architecture, while Una talks to Churchill's granddaughter Emma Soames.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team is in rural Cheshire, where Matt Baker finds out about agricultural apprentices, joining a student from Reaseheath College as he puts his learning into practice on his father's busy farm. Ellie Harrison discovers what life was like for apprentices in the Victorian era at Quarry Bank Mill and meets a modern-day heritage builder working on the site to restore it. Plus, Tom Heap explores the financial practicalities of buying a home in the countryside.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie and Sister Mary Cynthia team up to support a deaf mother-to-be, while another patient causes great concern when a case of morning sickness proves more serious than initially suspected. On the personal front, handyman Fred's daughter is less than delighted to hear about his forthcoming wedding. Will he be forced to choose between her and Violet? Last in the series.

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Period drama based on the novels by Winston Graham, originally adapted into a successful 1970s TV series. In late 18th-century Cornwall, Ross Poldark joins the army to avoid charges of smuggling, leaving behind his loved one Elizabeth - and when he returns three years later, having fought in the American War of Independence, he finds his father dead, his estate in ruins and his sweetheart engaged to another man. In need of help, he takes on a new kitchen maid after rescuing her from a beating - bringing him into conflict with hostile locals. Aidan Turner takes the title role, with Eleanor Tomlinson, Heida Reed, Phil Davis and Warren Clarke.

programme.title: BBC News; Regional News and Weather
Match of the Day 2
programme.sub-title: Match of the Day: FA Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the third match in the FA Cup sixth round, as Liverpool faced Blackburn Rovers at Anfield, with a semi-final place at stake. Rovers had already defeated Premier League Stoke City and Swansea City, but were clear underdogs against the Reds, who progressed to this stage with 2-1 wins in each of their three rounds so far.

programme.title: The Apprentice USA
programme.desc: In an extended edition featuring two tasks, the teams have to promote and sell tickets to a live comedy event, and then film a 60-second advertisement for a new car safety device. Even before the challenges are announced there's friction, with Star Jones refusing to work with NeNe Leakes any longer - so Donald Trump swaps her and Meat Loaf. How will the new dynamics affect the teams?

programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The researchers search for heirs on a huge family tree, and spend days trying to track them down. Plus, the investigation into a former civil servant's £160,000 estate, and details of more unclaimed properties.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts follow the fortunes of three more properties bought at auction and their new owners. In Harrow, north-west London, three friends transform a flat, while in Durham a seasoned developer renovates a three-bedroom property, and a PhD student in Stoke-on-Trent hopes to make money from their investment.

programme.title: The Legalizer
programme.desc: Gary Bell QC helps people take their cases through small claims courts. In the first edition, he heads to the Midlands to assist Sue Williams, who bought a narrowboat and planned to live on a marina, but after complaining that the development was not everything she had been led to believe, was ejected and forced to find a new home. On the south coast of England, the barrister tries to recoup the money Jan Koutris paid to a scam modelling agency that promised her daughter a lucrative career.

programme.title: Watchdog Test House
programme.desc: The programme offers advice on how people can protect their homes from flooding, and the best possible way to make a cup of tea. Presented by Sophie Raworth, Michelle Ackerley and Tony Livesey.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Anita Manning and Catherine Southon help a team of musicians and a couple who love skydiving search for valuable items in Brackley, south Northamptonshire, in the hope of making a profit at auction. Presented by Tim Wonnacott.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Heston helps a young boy with an overactive imagination deal with his parents' divorce, and an embarrassing photo of Karen is sent around at work. Meanwhile, Jimmi receives an unexpected phone call and Ayesha gets confirmation of Sierra's departure. Medical drama, starring Owen Brenman and Jan Pearson.

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: Return of the police drama set in the 1950s. A predator is targeting contestants in a beauty contest and Brinford's new WPC, Annie Taylor, is soon on the trail. Meanwhile, there is a shock in store for Briggs and DI Sawyer when old foes and wrong-doings come back to haunt them. Starring Claudia Jessie and Oliver Rix.

programme.title: The Link
programme.desc: Three teams battle it out to spot connections between an increasing number of clues and break the links on cash pods to secure a place in the Super Link final, and the chance to take home the money. Quiz show, hosted by Mark Williams.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to Somerset, where he helps a couple with a budget of £400,000 find a perfect countryside retreat. Away from the search, he visits Castle House in Taunton to get hands-on with some unusual medieval restoration work.

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Jonty Hearnden v Christina Trevanion Auction
programme.desc: Antiques experts Jonty Hearnden and Christina Trevanion vie to make the most money for their chosen charities by buying various items to sell on for a profit at the Reeman Dansie auction in Colchester, Essex.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.

programme.title: BBC Newsline
programme.desc: The latest news and views from around the Province.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Manchester United v Arsenal (Kick-off 7.45pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the fourth FA Cup sixth-round tie, which comes from Old Trafford. Having overcome a trio of teams from the bottom two tiers of the Football League, the Red Devils now face their toughest opponents in the form of Premier League rivals Arsenal, who along with themselves hold the record for most number of FA Cup wins at 11 apiece. While United have drawn some criticism for their style of play recently, the Gunners are well-renowned for their free-flowing and attractive style, albeit with limited success over the last decade, with their victory in the final of this competition last season providing their first trophy in nine seasons. These sides have already met once in the league during this campaign, and it was United who claimed a 2-1 victory at Emirates Stadium on that occasion. This programme will also include the draw for the semi-finals, which are to be staged at Wembley Stadium next month.

programme.title: Being James Galway
programme.desc: A portrait of the renowned flautist, charting his humble beginnings with a Belfast flute band and rise in the classical music world. The musician speaks candidly about his life and career, during which he has sold more than 30 million albums and, at the age of 75, continues to tour the world and give masterclasses. The documentary includes footage of the flautist backstage in rehearsals and during performances, as well as at his home in Switzerland. Featuring contributions by Melvyn Bragg, Riverdance composer Bill Whelan and the conductor of the Detroit Symphony Orchestra Leonard Slatkin. Narrated by Jeremy Irons. Previously shown on BBC1 Northern Ireland.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: What Britain Wants: Somewhere to Live
programme.desc: As the General Election approaches, Mariella Frostrup presents the second of four editions investigating whether modern-day Britain is up to the task of delivering on the things that have traditionally defined `good living'. The film focuses on homes and housing, including access to private, social and rented accommodation.

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: After nine years of classroom drama, which has seen seven headteachers come and go and even a move from Rochdale to Greenock, the time has finally come to close the gates on Waterloo Road in the last-ever episode. But will the school be forced to merge with Havelock High or will it manage to remain independent? The decision day arrives, but with no Vaughan to lead them, the pupils are forced to take matters into their own hands - and soon discover the council is not being entirely honest about its plans. Meanwhile, Marco grows suspicious of Lorna's ex-husband, only for his meddling to put him and Kenzie in danger. Last in the series. This episode can be seen at 8.30pm on BBC3.

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: In the run-up to Comic Relief night, comedians Jennifer Saunders, David Walliams, Jack Dee and Johnny Vegas, and singer Cheryl Fernandez-Versini join Graham on the sofa in this special edition to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the biennial fundraising extravaganza, the total of which looks like exceeding the £1billion mark this year.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A company tries to find beneficiaries to the £400,000 estate of a woman from Enfield, before hearing news that threatens the whole investigation. Elsewhere, the case of a missing man who lived in a shed for 20 years, who left behind a full military pension and substantial savings. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs are still to be found.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a smart-looking terrace in Pontygwaith in south Wales, a large Victorian house in Okehampton in Devon, and an old pub in Sittingbourne in Kent. All three buyers encounter unforeseen problems with their developments - and the presenters find out if - and how - they fixed their issues.

programme.title: The Legalizer
programme.desc: Gary Bell QC helps an American woman who rented a flat in north London, but found that her lettings agent had disappeared with her deposit when the lease was up. Plus, an Everton FC supporter in Liverpool wants his money back after his pre-booked coach to Wembley failed to turn up.

programme.title: Watchdog Test House
programme.desc: The presenters test non-stick frying pans, investigating whether more expensive versions provide better results. Plus, how to avoid administration fees when making changes to a holiday booking. With Sophie Raworth, Michelle Ackerley and Tony Livesey.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Jeremy Lamond and Kate Bliss help contestants find valuables to sell for profit at the Bourne Mill antiques centre in Farnham. Meanwhile, Tim Wonnacott visits Clandon Park in Surrey to visit Hinemihi, a Maori meeting house.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara sees a patient who is repeatedly falling unconscious for no obvious reason, while Jimmi goes to lunch with Heather, and Ayesha comes to terms with her loss. Medical drama, starring Elisabeth Dermot Walsh and Adrian Lewis Morgan.

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: Annie's involvement in a murder case causes a rift with her father. Elsewhere, Briggs struggles to be a good husband, while Susie continues to infuriate a lovesick Swift, and Fenton worries he is no longer able to do his job when an old colleague asks for help.

programme.title: The Link
programme.desc: Three teams battle it out to spot connections between an increasing number of clues and break the links on cash pods to secure a place in the Super Link final, and the chance to take home the money. Quiz show, hosted by Mark Williams.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple with a £430,000 budget search for a retirement property in north Wales. Away from the house hunt, the presenter tests her head for heights at a local landmark.

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Jonty Hearnden v Christina Trevanion UK Antiques Fair
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden and Christina Trevanion visit the Malvern Flea and Collectors Fair, and go head to head by purchasing items and then selling them at auction, aiming to make money for a chosen charity.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.

programme.title: BBC Newsline
programme.desc: The latest news and views from around the Province.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: With Shabnam still insisting on hiding their relationship, Kush suggests a romantic meal away from the Square - but their plan is thwarted when they bump into Martin, who drags them back to the Vic. They manage to eventually find a few moments alone, but they're being watched by Stacey. Will she keep their secret? They're not the only ones meeting up, as a lonely Carol and Billy also spend the evening together. They insist it'll be a night as friends only - but as the drink flows, things take an interesting turn. Meanwhile, further bad news prompts Kat to do a U-turn about Harry's money.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Harry comes out of his coma but it's clear he isn't out of the woods yet, leaving his colleagues with crucial decisions to make regarding his treatment - and as if that weren't bad enough, Mary-Claire comes into conflict with the patient's formidable mother. Jac and Guy leave Elliot in charge of Darwin while they deal with the fallout from the death of the professor's Kibo patient - although Jonny's arrest causes further shockwaves - and Arthur frets over which area of medicine he should specialise in, eventually finding inspiration in an unexpected place.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace return to put more keen cooks to the test. The first five hopefuls begin by serving up their Calling Card, a dish that showcases their talent - and this year, it carries a prize as the judges' two favourites will sail through to the third round. Then it's new challenge the Reinvention Test, in which they create a new plate of food based on their main ingredient from the first round, before one goes home and the rest cook dinner for a trio of former MasterChef champions.

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: Investigations into social and political issues affecting Northern Ireland.

programme.title: Kids in Camps: Comic Relief
programme.desc: Documentary following the lives of children displaced by the civil war in South Sudan, forcing them to live in temporary camps or refugee sites across the border in Northern Uganda. They include teenage sisters Grace and Anna, who fled for their lives while people were being killed all around them. Now they are desperate to continue their education. Others include 14-year-old Scovia, whose family are transferred to a refugee settlement where they are given a small plot of land and some simple tools with which to begin a new life.

programme.title: Hollywoodland
programme.desc: Fact-based mystery focusing on the life and sudden death of actor George Reeves, famed for his role as Superman in the 1950s TV series. The story is told in flashback through the eyes of a private investigator hired by Reeves' mother to unearth the truth surrounding his mysterious fate. Starring Ben Affleck, Adrien Brody, Diane Lane and Bob Hoskins.

programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.desc: The team investigates the case of a man who spent the last years of his life on the Essex coast, and the search for his relatives leads the heir hunters to Wales. Plus, members of a family who have connections to 19th-century transatlantic communications, and details of more unclaimed estates.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a former funeral directors in Maidstone, Kent, a two-bedroom flat in Cricklewood, north-west London, and a property in Stoke-on-Trent. They then find out what the buildings sold for at auction, and speak to the buyers about their plans.

programme.title: The Legalizer
programme.desc: A woman from the Midlands who believed she had bought her dream kitchen goes through the small claims court with the help of Gary Bell QC after the purchase turned out to be nothing but a disappointment. Plus, an Essex couple try to reclaim costs from a dodgy car deal.

programme.title: Watchdog Test House
programme.desc: Sophie Raworth reveals whether it is worth paying more for toilet roll, and the programme examines how sports helmets are put through their paces to ensure maximum protection.

programme.desc: Claire Rawle and Thomas Plant lead two teams who attempt to pick up bargains to hopefully sell on for a profit, scouring an antiques fair on the island of Anglesey before heading to an auction in Cheshire. Presented by Charles Hanson.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Al deals with a patient who treats him like her general problem solver, and also quizzes Jimmi about his relationship with Heather. Meanwhile, Ayesha struggles without Sierra. Medical drama, starring Ian Midlane and Laura Rollins.

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: Events take a sinister turn when DI Sawyer's missing suspect makes a violent reappearance, and the net tightens around Briggs as Coulson recruits Fenton to do his dirty work. Meanwhile, Annie and Tommy play Cupid with Susie and Swift. Starring Claudia Jessie and Oliver Rix.

programme.title: The Link
programme.desc: Three teams battle it out to spot connections between an increasing number of clues and break the links on cash pods to secure a place in the Super Link final, and the chance to take home the money. Quiz show, hosted by Mark Williams.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton heads to Dumfries and Galloway to help a couple find a rural home on a £300,000 budget. The presenter also visits Dumfriesshire's Drumlanrig Castle, where he learns about the important role played by working dogs in the history of the Buccleuch estates.

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Jonty Hearnden v Christina Trevanion Foreign Antiques Market
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden and Christina Trevanion visit the Porte de Vanves flea market in Paris with £750 worth of euros to spend, but the foreign currency, along with the language barrier, could prevent them buying the best antiques on offer at rock-bottom prices.

programme.title: Pointless

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Five more cooks compete for a place in the quarter-final, preparing a dish that represents who they are, before the three least successful hopefuls rustle up a different plate of food using the same main ingredient in the Reinvention Test. One cook is shown the door, and then the remaining four face the daunting task of preparing dinner for reigning MasterChef champion Ping Coombes and former finalists Jack Lucas and Luke Owen. But which pair will John Torode and Gregg Wallace put through? Continues tomorrow.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat's relatives are concerned by her sudden decision to accept Harry's inheritance money, so Stacey confronts her to make sure she is doing the right thing. Billy's request for a pay rise doesn't get quite the response he was hoping for, although he soon realises there could be more to Les's refusal when he comes across a few suspicious invoices. Sonia grows concerned about Carol when she begins to have trouble controlling her anger, Shabnam tells Kush she is ready for her family to know about their relationship, and Tamwar seeks advice on wooing Nancy.

programme.title: The People's Strictly for Comic Relief
programme.desc: It's the moment of truth for the six nominees who, after the excitement of being chosen and weeks of training, finally perform in the famous ballroom. Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present as the hopefuls and their professional partners take to the floor for just one dance, before facing the judging panel of Len Goodman, Bruno Tonioli, Darcey Bussell and Anton Du Beke (sitting in for Craig Revel Horwood). Their scores and opinions are just a guide, however, as at the end of the show the phone lines will open for the public to choose their favourite, with the winner announced during Friday night's Comic Relief. Last in the series.

programme.title: Nolan Live
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates with the studio audience and guest panellists.

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Olympic triathlon champion Alistair Brownlee, former Northern Ireland footballer Iain Dowie, 2010 Commonwealth Games gold medal-winning heptathlete Louise Hazel and Scotland rugby union star Greig Laidlaw join team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell on the quiz. Hosted by Sue Barker.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Suzi Perry is joined by Eddie Jordan and David Coulthard to look back at the 2014 F1 season, which was dominated by Mercedes drivers Lewis Hamilton and Nico Rosberg, who took the race for the title down to the final weekend in Abu Dhabi. Sebastian Vettel started the year as the reigning champion, but was outshone by new Red Bull team-mate Daniel Ricciardo, while Fernando Alonso ended his Ferrari career.

Plus, a case uncovers a connection to a serial killer arrested by the Metropolitan Police Service, and an American vaudeville performer who became a celebrity in London.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a semi-detached house in Northern Ireland, a flat in Newcastle and a basement apartment in Dover boasting fine views of the surrounding Kent landscape. Cameras capture the three properties being auctioned, and the presenters meet the new owners to learn about their plans for their acquisitions.

programme.title: The Legalizer
programme.desc: Gary Bell looks at the case of Zahida Altaf, from Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, who suffers from cerebral palsy. She bought a mobility scooter from a local dealer and when it broke down she returned it for him to fix - but never saw the item or her money again. In Wales, the QC comes to the aid of Joanna Chapelle, who ordered a camper van that arrived months later and was nowhere near up to scratch. Last in the series.

programme.title: Watchdog Test House
programme.desc: Sophie Raworth, Tony Livesey and Michelle Ackerley look at how to organise a large-scale fireworks display and ensure that people remain safe. Plus, how sound and smell are used to influence consumer choices. Originally billed on BBC Two tomorrow.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Thomas Plant and Philip Serrell help two teams search for valuable items in Leominster, Herefordshire, in the hope of making a profit at auction. Presenter Tim Wonnacott explores the life of car manufacturer William Morris, who brought motoring to the masses.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Karen gets involved in one of Rob's cases, despite being warned away. Meanwhile, Jimmi has a question to pose to Heather - but he is unsure how she will react. Medical drama, starring Jan Pearson, Chris Walker and Adrian Lewis Morgan.

programme.title: WPC 56
programme.desc: Coulson uses Briggs' misfortune as an opportunity to reassert his power at the station. DI Sawyer questions a suspect with a chilling wartime story, and Tommy struggles to act professionally when Gloria is accused of a crime. Meanwhile, Fenton makes a shocking discovery at a boarding house. Police drama set in the 1950s, starring John Bowler.

programme.title: The Link
programme.desc: Three teams battle it out to spot connections between an increasing number of clues and break the links on cash pods to secure a place in the Super Link final, and the chance to take home the money. Quiz show, hosted by Mark Williams.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a pair of recently retired teachers as they search for a rural home in Derbyshire. Away from the property search, the presenter goes underground to unearth a unique county gem.

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Jonty Hearnden v Christina Trevanion Car Boot
programme.desc: Antiques experts Jonty Hearnden and Christina Trevanion hunt for items of interest at an enormous car-boot sale in Essex. They aim to purchase bargains and sell them on, in a bid to make the most profit for their chosen charities.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The four heat winners enter the quarter-final, in which they face the daunting challenge of the Critic's Brief. Guest judge Jay Rayner gives them a simple instruction for a main dish - the twist being, the amateur cooks don't know who has set it until they come face to face with the food critic to hear his verdict. It's then back to the kitchen to prepare a dessert, again based on Rayner's brief - and this time, the one that doesn't make the grade fails to make it through to knockout week.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Hour-long episode. Kat is struggling to make ends meet, so Stacey and Mo go behind her back in an attempt to help. Shabnam is in reflective mood on the day of the Minute Mart closure, revealing her fears for the future to her family, while Tamwar's concerns are a little more immediate as he prepares for his lunch date with Nancy - and it seems his fears are well-founded when she breaks down over her family problems. Billy forces Les to reveal his secret to Pam, and Sonia continues to worry about Carol's odd behaviour.

programme.title: Comic Relief
programme.desc: As part of this year's Comic Relief, Lenny Henry leads a team of celebrities on a mission to rebuild a decrepit rural health centre in Uganda. What they find are semi-derelict buildings with no running water, no electricity and an infestation of rats and other vermin. As a result, many patients are too scared to stay the night. Can Dermot O'Leary, John Bishop, Richard Hammond, Steve Backshall, Doon Mackichan and Greg James give the centre the kiss of life it so desperately needs?

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: A review of the week's political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a debate from Leeds, where another panel of guests faces topical questions from the audience.

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil presents round-table chat, in which he and his guests take a light-hearted romp through the political and parliamentary developments of the past seven days. They'll be discussing who is making the headlines and the issues that matter to both MPs and the public.

programme.title: Afghanistan: A Service of Commemoration
programme.desc: Live footage of HM the Queen leading a commemorative service from St Paul's Cathedral to mark the end of combat operations in Afghanistan, followed by a parade and a fly-past paying tribute to those involved in the 13-year campaign. Presented by Huw Edwards.

programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott meets two teams of female contestants at an antiques fair on Gloucester docks, where they search for bargains they think will make a profit at the auction in Worcester. With experts Kate Bliss and James Lewis.

programme.desc: Heston finds himself caught in a love triangle when both the long-suffering wife and the mistress of a prospective MP seek his help. Meanwhile, Jimmi and Heather prepare to hold a dinner party for his colleagues, and although he tries to reassure her that all will go smoothly, some surprising revelations come to light once the alcohol starts flowing. Medical drama, starring Owen Brenman.

programme.desc: News of Briggs' death forces the team members to decide where their loyalties lie, but it remains to be seen whether they will take a stand against Coulson. Meanwhile, time is running out for Annie and DI Sawyer as they struggle to unlock the dark secrets of the Petra Project. Starring Claudia Jesse and Charlie De'Ath. A new series begins next week.

programme.title: The Link
programme.desc: Three teams battle it out to spot connections between an increasing number of clues and break the links on cash pods to secure a place in the Super Link final, and the chance to take home the money. Quiz show, hosted by Mark Williams.

It is important to the pair that the home has business potential, and they have set their budget at £475,000. While in the area, Nicki explores the local National Park and discovers places that are difficult to access by foot.

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Jonty Hearnden v Christina Trevanion Showdown
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden and Christina Trevanion face the antiques showdown, making purchases at four locations before selling at least half of them on at auction. In their battle for premium profits and the coveted title of champion, there are plenty of ups and downs before the overall winner is determined. Last in the series.
